{"type":"task_assignment","taskId":"1","subject":"Analyze task file structure and lifecycle","description":"Research how Claude Code stores and manages tasks for agent teams. Examine:
1. The ~/.claude/tasks/<team>/ directory structure
2. Individual task JSON files (1.json, 2.json, etc.) - their schema and fields
3. The tasks.json consolidated file - when it's created, its format
4. Task lifecycle: pending → in_progress → completed
5. Internal vs user tasks (_internal metadata flag)
6. Task fields: id, subject, description, status, owner, activeForm, blocks, blockedBy, metadata, createdAt, updatedAt
7. How tasks are created (TaskCreate tool), updated (TaskUpdate), listed (TaskList)

Look at the live demo-smoke-test team data in ~/.claude/tasks/demo-smoke-test/ and also examine the Hive source code in src/agent_teams/ to understand how it reads these files.

Write your findings to /Users/fr162241/Projects/hive/agent-teams-analysis/01-task-system.md

Also copy all task files from ~/.claude/tasks/demo-smoke-test/ to /Users/fr162241/Projects/hive/agent-teams-analysis/raw/tasks/","assignedBy":"task-analyst","timestamp":"2026-02-09T15:08:11.039Z"}
